Thankfully, Breanna saw to the destruction of her malfunctioning Malory vault, and it’s likely her quick thinking saved more enemy lives than she took in the entire campaign. Compensating her for her innovations on our design is, quite frankly, the least we can do, and an insulting minimum at that.”

traits.name: Blink Barrels
traits.description: When the Ozymandias makes a ranged or tech attack on its turn, it can target any character within Range 3 of an allied character that is at least partially in the Ozymandias's Sensors, measuring Line of Sight and Range from that allied character.

traits.name: Kingly Rebuke
traits.description: 1/round, when the Ozymandias makes an attack as a reaction against a hostile character, it can also make a Quick Tech action targeting that character as part of the attack.

traits.name: Strained Reactors
traits.description: The Ozymandias gains 1 additional Heat whenever a hostile character causes it to gain Heat.

synergies.detail: The Ozymandias gains 1 additional Heat whenever a hostile character causes it to gain Heat.

core_system.name: NILE-Class Dispersal
core_system.description: Pilot’s Log Addendum: Those water tanks the NIMUEs and ZOUs use need better cybersecurity, but I’ll send in the report after I get out of here. For now I can drink and I can dump heat, and that will have to be enough. Note to self: do not drink the NIMUE water. The NIMUE water is the bad water. If I get out of here alive I’m getting that tattooed on my arm.
core_system.active_effect: Choose any number of hostile characters in Range 50; those characters gain Lock On. For the rest of the scene, your Blink Barrels trait functions on every attack you make (rather than attacks made on your turn), and you draw your Threat from any allied character that is at least partially in Sensors in addition to yourself (meaning that you can make Overwatch reactions and melee attacks as if you were in those allies' positions).

name: JACK
description:
Only considered a MO&S mech by the most tenuous of connections, the JACK’s heritage is truthfully rooted in a desire for fame regardless of cost. Marley, Oz and Silver does not officially sell JACKs, though the eternally modifiable FRANKENSTEIN frame makes it easy for those with the manna to recreate the infamous machine.

Every year, the Iron Crown Tournaments Insect Class is one of the most well received and friendly of its many divisions, where small manufacturers bring home-grown designs from across the galaxy to compete with each other to gain fame in a contest that gives these smaller groups the ability to stand on even footing with the bigger corporations. A strong sense of camaraderie between various manufacturers is a major draw for watchers who would rather see teams who respect each other than those who are out for blood.

The JACK was the victor of the last of the Insect-Class Competitions, the custom creation of a minor barony heir who was desperate for the glory of a tournament win, bringing a frame that was technically based off a FRANKENSTEIN, with more manna spent on custom parts than the next three competitors combined and abusing the competition rules that gave extra tonnage to designers who used no Major Corporation parts.

The JACK absolutely devastated the competition, crushing personal projects and the dreams of university engineering teams alike. By the end of the contest it was the last one standing but the sheer disgust it had earned torpedoed the Insect Class in future years as viewers turned away from it, sponsors pulled out and many of the more beloved competitors chose not to compete.

A small price for fame, yes?

traits.name: Brutalize
traits.description: 1/round, when the Jack consumes Lock On with a melee attack, it deals +1d6 Bonus Damage on a hit. If the Jack destroys or causes structure damage to the target with this attack, another hostile character in Line of Sight is Slowed and Impaired until the end of their next turn, even if the Jack is intangible.

traits.name: Rival
traits.description: Adjacent hostile characters can use the Jack for hard cover.

core_system.name: “WHITECHAPEL” TARGET LOCK
core_system.description: Designed to isolate and pick off the weakest links of an enemy group one at a time, the Whitechapel Target lock floods the target’s systems with digital white noise that disrupts navigation and targeting systems.

passive_actions.name: Terrorize
passive_actions.detail:
Choose one character within line of sight, who becomes your Victim: they are Slowed and Impaired until the end of their next turn. When you make an attack against your Victim, you gain the benefits of having consumed Lock On.

After you choose a Victim, you cannot choose a new one until your current Victim is destroyed or the scene ends.

core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the scene, you gain the Lost in the Mist protocol.

active_actions.name: Lost in the Mist
active_actions.detail:
You can only take this action while you have a Victim of your Terrorize quick action.

When you activate this protocol, you and your Victim both become Intangible until the start of your next turn or until your mech is destroyed.

name: KELLY
description:
‘It needs to be cheap to make, tough and nobody needs to know I funded it’.

The origins of the KELLY are not quite the great symbol of resistance that the Ungrateful of Dawnline Shore would like to call it, an example of the humble innovation of the oppressed standing tall. Marley, Oz and Silver’s development was funded by the House of Sand as a project to obtain a design that could be shared with Dawnline Shore rebels against Harrison Armory without it ever being traced back to them. Marley, Oz and Silver, ever in need of funding, judged that they could kill two birds with one stone this way. Despite the questionable history, the KELLY has spread like wildfire among Ungrateful groups, who are unused to having frames that can actually take a beating and keep moving.

traits.name: Bushranger
traits.description: The Kelly can make reactions while grappling, and can't be moved involuntarily or knocked Prone by characters it is grappling.

traits.name: Black Iron Titan
traits.description: Hostile characters that are Engaged with the Kelly only have line of sight to adjacent spaces.

traits.name: It Has Come To This
traits.description: When the Kelly would Skirmish as part of Overwatch, it can instead Grapple. For this purpose Grapple is treated as Threat 3 and if successful, the target is pulled adjacent to the Kelly by the most direct path. If there are no suitable spaces, the grapple breaks and the target does not move.

core_system.name: Symbol of Resistance
core_system.description: The image of a Kelly in motion, trading shots with the most powerful of foes can inspire the weary to continue fighting for a few more breaths and shake the confidence of those opposing it.
core_system.passive_effect: 1/turn, when a hostile character makes an attack against an allied character adjacent to the Kelly, you can push the hostile character 3 spaces in any direction after the attack is resolved.
core_system.active_effect: One hostile character grappled by the Kelly suffers 2d6+6 AP Kinetic Damage. All hostile characters in line of sight of the target are pushed 3 spaces in any direction and sent reeling; until the end of their next turn, they are Slowed, Impaired, and unable to take reactions.

name: TEPES
description:
OZ Prime: We need solutions. Development can't find a way to deal with this and we’re running on fumes for budget after your last outing.
PERSEPHONE Prime: We might not have it, but try reaching out. Not everyone wants manna for their time.
OZ: The people who might have these solutions do.
PERSEPHONE: Maybe OSIRIS? You've seen the videos.
OZ: Were we on any less than the three-hundredth attempt, I would not have entertained the option.
PERSERPHONE: Which are you on, again?
OZ: Five hundred and eleven.

traits.name: Dominate
traits.description: When the Tepes Overcharges, it gains +1 Accuracy to its next tech attack in the same turn, and that attack inflicts 1 additional Heat.

synergies.detail: When the Tepes Overcharges, it gains +1 Accuracy to its next tech attack in the same turn, and that attack inflicts 1 additional Heat.

traits.name: Backwash Systems
traits.description: Whenever the Tepes targets an allied character with a tech action, it may clear one of the following conditions from the target that wasn't caused by their own systems, talents, etc.: Impaired, Slowed, Immobilized, Jammed, Shredded, or Stunned. If the Tepes does this, it gains that condition until the end of its next turn or the condition's original duration, whichever would be longer. This does not count as being caused by your own talents.

core_system.name: Lifeblood
core_system.description:
“How did you manage this one, OZ? Last I checked your team was ready to throw in the towel.”
“Took some inspiration from our time in the service, Jacob.”
“Which fight, again?”
core_system.passive_effect: You have the Mindbite Invade option.

passive_actions.name: Mindbite
passive_actions.detail: You clear up to two conditions that weren't caused by your own systems, talents, etc. Your target then gains those conditions until the end of their next turn. In addition, you may clear 1 Heat.

core_system.active_effect:
You can activate this protocol even if you are Stunned.

For the rest of the scene, you may conduct Invasion attacks with the Mindbite option even if you are Jammed or Stunned, and your Mindbite Invade inflicts one additional Heat on its target.
